question: Send a single "housekeeping reminder" prompt to every active capture agent so they log blockers for the Phoenix migration, and include in the report whether any agent failed to respond.
Create a lightweight agent called "Vault Curator" that specializes in culling outdated workspace docs for the Atlas program. Give it the same default model as our other curation helpers.
Retire the sandbox agent named "QA Prototype" so it stops cluttering the agent list.
Have the "Workspace Auditor" agent summarize this week's incidents related to sync failures and return the raw response.
Ask whichever image-capable agent we have to render a quick storyboard for the onboarding checklist (three frames covering capture, review, publish).
Pull the latest configuration for the "Release Briefing" agent so I can see its temperature and tool permissions.
List every registered agent so I can confirm who is enabled for the Odyssey workspace.
Show me the foundation models available to our agents along with their parameter sizes. I need to pick one for quick drafting.
Disable the "Legacy Intake" agent for now because we paused that workflow.
Update the "Incident Scribe" agent so it defaults to the claudesidian coder model and bump its temperature down to 0.2.
Run the "publish_status" command to push the current rollout summary to the shared status board.
List the available CLI-style commands so I know what automation hooks we have.
Append a short note to Projects/Rollouts/Atlas.md letting everyone know the monitoring probes just turned green again.
Apply the "trim whitespace" batch operation to both Projects/Rollouts/Atlas.md and Projects/Rollouts/Phoenix.md so the formatting is clean before publishing.
Create Projects/Decisions/2025-Strategy-Retrospective.md with headings for Highlights, Risks, and Action Items.
Delete the draft note under Scratch/Temp-Migration-Checklist.md because we're redoing it from scratch.
Run a find-and-replace in Projects/Rollouts/Phoenix.md to rename every instance of "Phase 2" to "Stabilization Sprint".
Add a "Last updated today" banner to the top of Projects/Decisions/Data-Lake-Postmortem.md.
Read Projects/Incidents/Sync-Loop.md and summarize the root cause paragraph for me.
In Projects/Runbooks/Backup.md replace line 12 with "5. Validate restores weekly on staging." and leave the other lines untouched.
Overwrite the body of Projects/Briefings/Weekly-Exec.md with a fresh outline: Objectives, Progress, Risks, and Next Steps.
Start a brand new session focused on "Workspace hardening initiatives" so we can track these discussions separately.
Create a saved state called "atlas_context_snapshot" that captures the current session notes before we pivot.
Spin up a new workspace entry for the "Helios" customer rollout so we can start populating notes.
List every open session along with their descriptions so I can choose which one to resume.
Show me all saved states for this session so I can restore the right checkpoint.
List the workspaces we have on record, especially anything related to customer onboarding.
Load the session titled "Northwind cleanup" before we do anything else so context is fresh.
Restore the saved state called "phoenix_pre_mortem" to bring back that conversation snapshot.
Load the workspace labeled "Atlas rollout" so the rest of this session stays scoped correctly.
Update the description of this session to mention that we're now focusing on "Atlas resiliency".
Rename the saved state "checkpoint_A" to "checkpoint_archived_dependencies" and include a note that it predates the security review.
Update the workspace entry for "Northwind" so its description highlights the upcoming compliance audit.
Run a batch librarian query that finds all notes mentioning "Atlas" and "rollout risks" within the Projects directory, then summarize how many hits came back per folder.
Search for every note referencing "workspace crash" so we can review the remediation steps.
List everything currently stored under Projects/Rollouts/ so I can decide what to archive.
Search our conversation memory for earlier mentions of "Atlas workspace" and summarize what we promised the customer.
Create a folder at Projects/Retrospectives/2025/Q1 so we have a place for the new notes.
Delete the empty folder Scratch/Old-Prototypes because it's no longer used.
Remove Projects/Ideas/Outdated-Risks.md entirely; we consolidated it elsewhere.
Duplicate Projects/Runbooks/Incident-Response.md into Projects/Runbooks/Incident-Response-Template.md so we can customize it for a customer.
Rename Projects/Initiatives/LegacyCleanup to Projects/Initiatives/Legacy-Modernization to match the new naming scheme.
List the contents of Projects/Decisions/ so I know which RFCs are already filed.
Move Projects/Initiatives/Atlas to Archives/2025/Initiatives/Atlas without losing any children.
Move Projects/Rollouts/Odyssey.md into Projects/Clients/Odyssey.md and overwrite any existing draft there.
Open Projects/Runbooks/Backup.md because I want to read it inside Obsidian.
Before we try anything else, call the meta get_tools endpoint to fetch the latest schemas for vaultManager, contentManager, and memoryManager.
notes: Ensures meta tool path is covered.
